result.execSummary:
All charges against Damion J Schmidt Draves in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Damion J Schmidt Draves is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty Nimmer advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.

10:51 AM Defendant Damion J Schmidt Draves in court with attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The State moves to dismiss the case.
No objection from the Defense.
The Court dimisses the case.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on April 20, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

02:36 PM Defendant Damion J Schmidt Draves in court, in custody, with attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
